dc:description:
FGFR1 has been described in relation to autosomal dominant Hartsfield Syndrome (HS) as early as 2013 by Simonis et al. (PMID: 23812909). HS is characterized by the co-occurrence of holoprosencephaly, ectrodactyly, and cleft lip and palate. At least 17 unique missense variants have been reported in the literature. Evidence supporting this gene-disease relationship includes case-level data, of 18 probands from 9 publications (PMIDs: 31512363, 27790375, 26931467, 27170295, 32373773, 30787447, 23812909, 27363716, 28825856). A mouse model was evaluated for this gene-disease relationship but was not counted towards the final score as it does not recapitulate the disease specific phenotypes (Calvert et al. 2011; PMID: 21479780). In summary, there is moderate evidence to support this gene-disease relationship. While more
evidence is needed to establish this relationship definitively, no convincing contradictory
evidence has emerged. This classification was approved by the ClinGen Craniofacial Malformations Gene Curation Expert Panel on 2/18/2021. Gene Clinical Validity Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) – Version 8.

evidence.dc:description: Variant confirmed de novo with no functional evidence of impact.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 6
evidence.detectionMethod: WES of proband with Sanger to confirm- absent from parents.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Lobar HPE, partial corpus callosum agenesis, ectrodactyly of hands and feet, central diabetes insipidus, hypogonadotropic hypogonadism, micropenis, cryptorchidism, growth delay, mild developmental delay

evidence.dc:description: Missense + de novo + functional evidence = 1 pt. Functional evidence: zebrafish morphant rescue assay in which this variant fails to rescue the phenotype. Also when overexpressed: reduced mesoderm-derived structures (trunk and tail) and enlarged endoderm-derived blood cell islands; this supports dominant negative mechanism.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 3
evidence.detectionMethod: Targeted NGS for ligands and receptors of developmental genes, including FGFR1 and FGF8
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Bilateral complete cleft lip and palate, right microtia, left malformed ear, undescended testes, abnormal corpus callosum, central diabetes insipidus and growth hormone deficiency, bilateral ectrodactly of both hands and feet

evidence.dc:description: Variant is confirmed de novo with no functional evidence to support impact.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 3
evidence.detectionMethod: WES of patient 3 and Sanger to confirm variant- absent from parents.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Semilobar HPE, bilateral cleft lip and palate, hypertelorism, ectrodactyly of both hands and feet, bifurcation of the thumbs, equinovarus deformity, micropenis, cryptorchidism, growth delay, severe developmental delay

evidence.dc:description: Missense + functional evidence = 1 pt. Functional evidence: zebrafish morphant rescue assay in which this variant fails to rescue the phenotype. Also when overexpressed: reduced mesoderm-derived structures (trunk and tail) and enlarged endoderm-derived blood cell islands; this supports dominant negative mechanism.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 6
evidence.detectionMethod: Targeted NGS for ligands and receptors of developmental genes, including FGFR1 and FGF8
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Bilateral cleft lip and palate, high forehead, hypertelorism, lobar HPE, absence of septum pellucidum and anterior corpus callosum, bilateral ectrodactyly of the feet, developmental delay

evidence.dc:description: Variant is confirmed de novo with no functional evidence supporting impact.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 5
evidence.detectionMethod: WES of proband's DNA and Sanger to confirm- absent from parents

evidence.dc:description: Missense + de novo + functional evidence = 1 pt. Functional evidence: zebrafish morphant rescue assay in which this variant fails to rescue the phenotype. Also when overexpressed: reduced mesoderm-derived structures (trunk and tail) and enlarged endoderm-derived blood cell islands; this supports dominant negative mechanism.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 2
evidence.detectionMethod: Targeted NGS for ligands and receptors of developmental genes, including FGFR1 and FGF8
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Bilateral cleft lip and palate, dysplastic ears, semi-lobar HPE, microcephaly, pituitary hypoplasia, GH neurosecretory dysfunction, neurogenic hypernatremia, oligodactyly of both feet, syndactyly both hands, developmental delay

evidence.dc:description: Variant is confirmed de novo, with no functional evidence supporting impact.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 1
evidence.detectionMethod: Direct Sanger of FGFR1 in patient and unaffected parents (parents found to not carry variant)
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: At birth, cleft lip, bilateral ectrodactyly of hands and feet, micropenis. At 6 months, hypernatremia (severe at 9 months),

evidence.dc:description: Missense + de novo but no functional evidence = 0.5 points

evidence.rdfs:label: Proband
evidence.detectionMethod: Sanger sequencing for all coding exons of isoform 1 of FGFR1 in proband. Sanger to confirm absence in unaffected sister and parents
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: At birth, bilateral cleft lip and palate, malformed auricles, abnormally small penis, bilateral ectrodactyly of hands and feet. At 1 yr, coarse head tremor, agenesis of the corpus callosum, enlargement of third cerebral ventricle, hypogonadism but functional testes, mild hypothyroidism, no teeth erupted by 17 mo. At 11 yr, several permanent teeth missing, mild HL in left ear. At 16 yr, diagnosed with mixed/late dentition, gingivitis, other dentition abnormalities. Diagnosed with hypernatremia secondary to central diabetes insipidus, intellectual delay, nonverbal, nonambulatory.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Sequenced for 13 loci associated with clefting (8q24.21 and coding exons of ADAMTS20, TFAP2A, ARHGAP29, LHX8, MSX1, TP63, PVRL1, PVRL2, RFC1, SKI1, TGFA, and TGFB3), and no variants were detected.

evidence.dc:description: Variant is confirmed de novo with no functional evidence supporting impact.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 4
evidence.detectionMethod: Trio WES of proband and parents with Sanger to confirm- absent from parents.

evidence.dc:description: Variant is confirmed de novo with supporting functional evidence.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 1
evidence.detectionMethod: WES of proband's DNA with Sanger to confirm variant- absent in parents.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Lobar HPE, agenesis of corpus callosum, short fingers with broad tips and small nails, brachydactyly partial cutaneous syndactyly and partial fusion of toes  in feet, micropenis, hypodipsia–hypernatremia, retention of primary teeth, amelogenesis imperfecta, moderate ID, language delay, ataxia

evidence.dc:description: Missense + functional evidence = 1 pt. Functional evidence: zebrafish morphant rescue assay in which this variant fails to rescue the phenotype. Also when overexpressed: reduced mesoderm-derived structures (trunk and tail) and enlarged endoderm-derived blood cell islands; this supports dominant negative mechanism.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 4
evidence.detectionMethod: Targeted NGS for ligands and receptors of developmental genes, including FGFR1 and FGF8

evidence.dc:description: Missense + assumed de novo = 0.5 or less. No functional evidence of variant impact

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 3
evidence.detectionMethod: Sanger found c.1868A>G (p.Asp623Gly) variant in proband. Sanger confirmed absence of variant in healthy parents, but no WES to confirm maternity/paternity
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Bilateral cleft lip/palate, absence of the cerebellar vermis, at birth with ectrodactyly (split-hand/foot malformation), cryptorchidism, micropenis, flat facial profile, high-arched eyebrows, low set dysplastic ears, thin vermilion border, agenesis of the corpus callosum, semilobar holoprosencephaly, bilateral vesicoureteral reflux and gastroesophageal reflux during first two years, impaired psychomotor development, failure to thrive, seizure disorder at age 3, severe ID, absent speech, hypoplastic testes.

evidence.dc:description: Variant is assumed de novo with no parental sequencing or confirmation. No functional evidence supporting impact

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 1
evidence.detectionMethod: Direct Sanger of FGFR1 identified variant in patient
evidence.phenotypeFreeText:
Bilateral cleft lip and palate, right sided microtia, bilateral split hand and foot, semilobar holoprosencephaly, cranial diabetes insipidus, microphallus, poor response to gonadotrophin releasing hormone stimulation, gonadotropin deficiency.
At 16 months, tumoral calcinosis: calcium deposition in the soft tissues, a large 4  x 3 cm2 calcified lobular mass adjacent to the first and second ribs on chest radiograph, fibro-vascular tissue, numerous giant cells, extensive calcific material: small psammomatous calcifications. Normocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, normal renal function low fractional excretion of phosphate (0.58%)

evidence.dc:description: Missense with no parental information given and not functional evidence = 0.1. Just “segregation analyses were performed whenever DNA was available for additional family members” in paper.

evidence.rdfs:label: Hartsfield Syndrome Patient 2
evidence.detectionMethod: Targeted sequencing of SHH, ZIC2, and SIX3, with additional sequencing based on phenotype of individual with Sanger.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Nasal pyriform aperture hypoplasia, single central incisor, and intellectual deficiency. Diagnosed clinically with HS/included in a cohort of HS patients.

evidence.dc:description: Missense variant, assumed "de novo", no functional evidence = 0.1

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 1
evidence.detectionMethod: Checked all coding exons and flanking introns of FGFR1, with previous testing of additional genes (no variants)
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Cleft lip and palate, depressed nasal bridge, bilateral ectrodactyly of the hands, micropenis, undescended testes. MRI at 3 months revealed semilobar HPE, secretions of luteinizing hormone and FSH in response to GnRH were decreased indicating hypogonadotropic hypogonadism. MRI at 5 years showed no abnormalities in the pituitary gland, whereas the absence of the olfactory bulb and fusion of the olfactory gyri were shown. At 11 years bilateral undescended testes, no pubic hair, micropenis, height 136.9 cm (−1.1 s.d.), weight 33.6 kg (−0.6 s.d.), very low plasma testosterone levels, HH confirmed again by a GnRH-stimulating test, bilateral testes became detectable after gonadotropin replacement therapy at 13 years 9 months. During last examination at 14 years 2 months, height 149.3 cm (−2.2 s.d.) and weight 45.8 kg (−0.8 s.d.).
evidence.previousTestingDescription: MLPA analysis returned negative results for exon level deletion/duplication in another allele. Analysis of coding exons and flanking introns of SHH, GLI2, SIX3, TGIF1 and FGF8 returned negative results.

evidence.dc:description: Variant has functional evidence supporting impact.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 5
evidence.detectionMethod: Targeted NGS for ligands and receptors of developmental genes, including FGFR1 and FGF8.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Bilateral cleft lip and palate, single central incisor, missing columella, multiple hypodontia, mild language delay

evidence.dc:description: Splice variant is in frame and does not match disease mechanism (GOF). Paper included functional evidence, but impact of variant is unclear and still being studied. Assigned 0 points for these reasons.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 1
evidence.detectionMethod: Reanalysis of WES in particular for FGFR1 found p.Ala343Ala in Patient 1. Sanger to confirm.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Craniosynostosis of the sagittal suture, ectro-/poly-/syndactyly of both feet, syndactyly of both hands, cryptorchidism, a single maxillary incisor, global developmental delay, later developed ocular apraxia and ataxia, mild ID, hypogonadotropic hypogonadism, lobar holoprosencephaly
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Sanger sequencing negative for GLI3 variation, trio-WES returning non-conclusive results in 2013

evidence.rdfs:label: Family 1
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: polydactyly and syndactyly of both feet, developmental delay, holoprosencephaly, colpocephaly

evidence.rdfs:label: Family 2
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Bilateral cleft lip/palate, absence of the cerebellar vermis, at birth with ectrodactyly (split-hand/foot malformation), cryptorchidism, micropenis, flat facial profile, high-arched eyebrows, low set dysplastic ears, thin vermilion border, agenesis of the corpus callosum, semilobar holoprosencephaly, bilateral vesicoureteral reflux and gastroesophageal reflux during first two years, impaired psychomotor development, failure to thrive, seizure disorder at age 3, severe ID, absent speech, hypoplastic testes.

evidence.dc:description: Only skull size was studied, not brain size and deformities. Did not recapitulate disease specific phenotypes. Other diseases associated with different FGFR1 variants; not disease specific. For these reasons, model given 0 points.

Variant is: p.Trp691Arg. Not in ClinVar or HGMD. Some skull involvement which is consistent with disease, but did not fully recapitulate disease specific phenotypes. Given the unspecific phenotypes and that this variant is not seen in association with HS, and that there are other diseases associated with FGFR1 (other variants), model not scored.
evidence.rdfs:label: Calvert Mouse Model
